Ray Rangkuti: Jokowi Harusnya Sejak Awal Tak Janjikan Perppu
02 Nov 2019, 01:01 by Muhammad Irfan
JAKARTA, (PR).- Aktivis yang juga pendiri Lembaga Swadaya Masyarakat Lingkar Madani, Ray Rangkuti menilai ketidakmauan Presiden Joko Widodo mengeluarkan Peraturan Pengganti Undang Undang terkait UU KPK karena alasan menggu proses di Mahkamah Konstitusi harusnya disampaikan sejak awal. Jangan sampai langkah ini ibarat memberi harapan palsu pada publik.
“Jika begitu adanya, rasanya ia tidak memerlukan waktu yang lama untuk menjawab soal apakah akan mengeluarkan Perppu atau tidak,” kata Ray, kepada “PR”, Jumat, 1 November 2019.
Sebagai seorang Presiden, Jokowi tentu saja memiliki lebih dari cukup informasi soal adanya uji materi revisi UU KPK ke MK. Dan dengan informasi itu, sedianya presiden tidak perlu membuat janji untuk menerbitkan Perppu atau tidak.
“Cukup beliau sampaikan bahwa Perppu tidak dalam opsinya karena revisi UU KPK sejak satu hari ia ditetapkan telah digugat ke MK,” ucap dia.
Ray menilai penggunaan alasan masih menunggu putusan MK untuk tidak menerbitkan Perppu juga janggal. Apalagi sampai menggunakan bumbu bahasa sopan dan santun pula. Padahal, lanjut Ray, tidak menepati janji juga jelas bukanlah tindakan yang sopan santun.
“Berterus terang sejak awal bahwa opsi Perppu tidak akan dikeluarkan jika ada masyarakat yang melakukan gugatan atas revisi UU itu adalah cermin dari sikap sopan dan santun itu. Seperti presiden bersikap sopan atas kelembagaan negara, kewajibannya juga adalah bersikap sopan pada rakyatnya,” ucap dia.
Ray menambahkan: “Jika memang tidak siap mengeluarkan Perppu, mestinya diungkapkan sejak awal. Agar masyarakat tidak dalam posisi terombang ambing, menaikan asa, menanti harap lalu dikecewakan,” ucap dia.***

Ray Rangkuti: Jokowi Shouldn't Have Promised Perppu from the Beginning
02 Nov 2019, 01:01 by Muhammad Irfan
JAKARTA, (PR). An activist who is also the founder of the Non-Governmental Circle Society of Madurese, Ray Rangkuti, assesses President Joko Widodo's unwillingness to issue a Law on the Lieu of Law relating to the Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) because the reason for using the process in the Constitutional Court should be conveyed from the beginning. Do not let this step is like giving false hope to the public.
"If that is the case, it seems he does not need a long time to answer the question of whether or not to issue a Perppu," Ray said, to "PR", Friday, November 1, 2019.
As a President, Jokowi certainly has more than enough information about the existence of a material revision test of the KPK Law to the MK. And with that information, the president should not have made an appointment to issue a Perppu or not.
"He simply said that the Perppu was not in its options because the revision of the KPK Law since one day it was determined to have been sued by the Court," he said.
Ray considered that the use of reason was still awaiting the Constitutional Court's decision not to issue a Perppu. Moreover, to use a polite and polite language spice as well. In fact, continued Ray, not keeping promises was also clearly not an act of courtesy.
"It was clear from the beginning that the Perppu option would not be issued if there were people who filed a lawsuit over the revision of the Act that was a reflection of that polite and polite attitude. Like the president being polite to state institutions, his obligation is also to be polite to his people, "he said.
Ray added: "If it is indeed not ready to issue a Perppu, it should be disclosed from the start. So that the community is not in a position to be oscillated, raising hopes, waiting and hoping to be disappointed, "he said. ***
